A.name: Generalized System of Preferences (GSP)
A.notes: Beneficiary developing countries. Check current country/product eligibility — GSP periodically expires and is renewed.

A+.name: GSP — Least-Developed Beneficiary Developing Country
A+.notes: Expanded GSP for least-developed countries. Broader product coverage than standard GSP.

A*.name: GSP — Eligible but excluded for specific country
A*.notes: Product is GSP-eligible but excluded for the specific beneficiary country.

CA.name: USMCA — Canada
CA.notes: Replaced NAFTA. Requires USMCA certificate of origin.

D.name: African Growth and Opportunity Act (AGOA)
D.authority: Title I, Trade and Development Act of 2000
D.notes: Sub-Saharan African countries. Check current beneficiary status — countries can be added/removed.

IL.name: United States-Israel FTA
IL.notes: Also covers qualifying industrial zones (QIZ) in Jordan and Egypt.

MX.name: USMCA — Mexico
MX.notes: Replaced NAFTA. Requires USMCA certificate of origin.

R.name: Caribbean Basin Trade Partnership Act (CBTPA)
R.notes: Enhanced preferences for apparel from CBERA-eligible countries.

usage_notes.decoding_special_column: The 'special' field in HTS data lists program codes in parentheses, e.g., 'Free (A+,AU,BH,CL,CO,D,E,IL,JO,KR,MA,OM,P,PA,PE,S,SG)'. Each code indicates the preferential rate applies when goods originate from qualifying countries under that program.
usage_notes.verification_required: Always verify current program eligibility. GSP and AGOA have expiration dates and may not be active. Country eligibility can change. Product-specific rules of origin must be met.
usage_notes.column_2_countries: Column 2 (non-NTR) rates apply to: Cuba, North Korea, and potentially others designated by the President. These rates are significantly higher than Column 1.
